greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of multisets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet such that for k>0 the k-th letter occurs at least once and within each word every letter of the alphabet is at least as frequent as the subsequent alphabet letter; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k <= n.  T(n,k) = 0 for k > n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened

A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(d*
mathematica: Sum[b[n - j, j, t - 1]/j!, {j, i, n/t}]];
A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[d*
g[d, k], {d, Divisors[j]}]*A[n - j, k], {j, 1, n}]/n];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 09 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Columns k=0-1 give: A000007, A000041 (for n>0).
